slide.title: Police spray coloured water on pro-BNP-Jamaat lawyers using a water-cannon while keeping the Supreme Court's gate closed, barring them from joining the “March for Democracy” yesterday called by BNP Chairperson Khaleda Zia to force the government to cancel the "one-sided" January 5 parliamentary election. Photo: Anisur rahman, Amran hossain
An activist of the ruling Awami League (AL) attacks a rickshaw outside the gate suspecting the passengers to be pro-BNP-Jamaat lawyers. Photo: Anisur Rahman, Amran hossain
A victim of the clash that followed an attack by some 300 to 400 AL men on the lawyers inside the Supreme Court compound. Photo: Anisur Rahman, Amran hossain
Flames devour a motorcycle set alight by the attackers inside the Supreme Court premises. Photo: Anisur Rahman, Amran hossain
One of the attackers try to set a bicycle on fire. Photo: Anisur Rahman, Amran hossain
One elderly attacker uses a slingshot on the lawyers. Photo: Anisur Rahman, Amran hossain
Supporters of the AL right before police threaten with sticks pro-BNP journalists inside Jatiya Press Club in the capital. Photo: Anisur Rahman, Amran hossain

A policeman tries to dissuade AL men from attacking the journalists and a generator of theirs brought to power a rally demanding release of Amar Desh acting editor Mahmudur Rahman.Photo: Anisur Rahman, Amran hossain
BNP supporters retaliate with brick chips during the attack. Photo: Anisur Rahman, Amran hossain
